title: Motivation
text:
Sri Lanka has a rich history of blending mathematics and art, especially in its ancient architecture, wall paintings, frescoes and murals. This study investigates the potential of machine learning to reveal mathematical patterns concealed in ancient paintings and artifacts.
Figures 1 to 5 show some Sri Lankan wall paintings and artefacts embedded with mathematical principles such as geometry, tessellation, symmetry, coloring algorithms, motifs, and more. This further reinforces my belief: Behind every mathematician lies an artist, and behind every artist lies a mathematician.

title: Exploring Artistic Legacy: Analyzing Artifact Differences Across Kingdoms Using Machine Learning
text:
This research project is a new journey from Machine Learning to Kingdom Learning with Mathematics, Art and Data Science (MADS), exploring mathematical concepts embedded in historical paintings and their evolution across different kingdoms in Sri Lanka.
This research strongly aligns with the 2025 International Day of Mathematics theme: Mathematics, Art, and Creativity, emphasizing the importance of the intersection between mathematics and art.
